description.p: The Oath of the Templar calls to those who dedicate their lives to protecting the world from the misuse of magic. Templars are divine warriors who specialize in suppressing spellcasters, banishing demons, and purging corrupt arcane forces. They are unyielding bastions against magical threats, using their divine power to resist and dismantle the most dangerous of spells.
Shield the InnocentProtect those who are powerless against magical abuse.
Purge The CorruptHunt down and destroy those who use magic for evil ends.
Endure The ArcaneStrengthen your body and spirit to resist magic’s influence.
Balance The ScalesMagic is neither inherently good nor evil—it is intent that defines its worth. Strike down those who misuse this gift.
You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Arcane SuppressionAs an action, you present your holy symbol and create a 30-foot radius of anti-magic energy. Creatures concentrating on spells within the radius must make a Constitution saving throw or lose concentration. All spells of 3rd level or lower on creatures of your choice within the radius immediately end.

Spellbane Strike When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use your Channel Divinity to disrupt its magical abilities. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to cast leveled spells that require a verbal component for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

description.p: Your divine magic has shifted, no longer targeting undead or fiends, but those who practice dark arts and forbidden spellcasting. Your Divine Smite no longer deals an additional 1d8 damage to undead or fiends. Instead, it now targets those you are sworn to stop and possibly destroy. When you use Divine Smite, you deal an extra 1d8 damage to mages, demons, and abominations.

sheet.description: Your divine smite damage only increases by 1d8 if the target is an mage, demon or abomination

description.p: At 5th level, you learn to reach out and close the area around the veil leaving no room for magic to enter for a brief time, rigorous training to separate the veil of magic allows you to disrupt spells as they are being cast. You learn to cast Counterspell as a 2nd-level spell. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses after a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast Counterspell as a 2nd-level spell.

description.p: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain protection against hostile magic: Advantage on Saving Throws: You and affected allies have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Damage Mitigation: When an affected creature takes damage from a spell, they reduce the damage by an amount equal to 2 × your Charisma modifier + 2
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet and damage reduced is 3 x charisma modifier + 3

description.p: At 15th level, your divine connection to anti-magic strengthens: When you successfully use Counterspell or Dispel Magic, you regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your Paladin level. You gain advantage on saving throws against spells of 6th level or lower.

sheet.description: When you successfully use Counterspell or Dispel Magic, you regain hit points equal to 1d10 + {{arcane-devourer:count}}. You gain advantage on saving throws against spells of 6th level or lower.

description.p: At 20th level, you become a beacon of anti-magic energy. As an action, you can radiate a powerful anti-magic aura in a 30-foot radius for 1 minute:The area within the aura functions as an antimagic field (as per the spell). Creatures within the aura must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw at the start of their turn or lose the ability to cast spells until the start of their next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
